Description: Papyrus written with black ink, demotic legal document dated to month of Phamenoth of year 17 of Ptolemy Euergetes I. 5 lines on recto, names of 16 witnesses on verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Divorce between the man of Syene Panofer called Pa-egosh (Pekusis) and his wife Tanofer daughter of Amenhotep. Scribe Amenhotep son of Hery (Erieus)". Concerning Tanefer, cf. P BM EA 10073; on her divorce, cf. P BM EA 10079 B-C.
Curator's comments: Thompson MS: "Publ. Revillout, rev. eg. I 119 and Chrest. dem. p.cxxxvi. Reich.u.s. p.43 pl.VI, VII, IX. cf Spiegelberg. Veroff and d. Badischen, Pap.- Samml.i.p.t.seg." Rde: 13, 110, 5). Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Bibliographic references: Pestman 1961 / Marriage and matrimonial property in ancient Egypt : a contribution to establishing the legal position of the woman (diagr. Z, no.6)
Reich 1914 / Papyri juistischen Inhalts in hieratischer und demotischer Schrift aus dem British Museum (p.43-51, pl.6-7, 9)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (2722) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/2722)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape, copydex self adhesive carpet tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: fair
